column4: Does anyone in here know if there is a standalone app with the same or at least similar functionality to the clip in the WindowMaker GUI?
I want to use the WindowMaker GUI, instead of GNOME, KDE, etc., but with compositing support.
The WindowMaker GUI is based on NextSTEP, and consists of a dock (which is easy to get, like GNOME-Do's Docky), and a clip (which I can't find).

The clip is basically the same thing as a dock, in that you can attach launchers and dockapps to it, but you can also hide the things attached, and the clip is per workspace, unlike the dock, which shows the same thing on all workspaces.
if you want dock then try cairo dock
I have a dock. I need the clip.
i dont know what clip is. sorry
arora keeps me signing out of gmail. is this bug? any help?

The clip is basically the same thing as a dock, in that you can attach launchers and dockapps to it, but you can also hide the things attached, and the clip is per workspace, unlike the dock, which shows the same thing on all workspaces.
have you tried cairo dock? i remember something cairo does the same give it a try
I'll look, but I doubt it's anything like a clip.
give a try if you dont like you can uninsatll it.
